cohort: Crypto-native individuals and early Web3 users in India who hold digital assets, plus small merchants and freelancers seeking crypto payment acceptance
productName: Pluto PE - Non-Custodial Crypto Wallet with Debit Cards & DeFi Services
userContext: Crypto-native users and merchants wanting to spend crypto like regular money (Visa debit card) or accept crypto payments with INR settlement. High intent but need to see value (debit card, lower fees, DeFi services) before committing to 8-step wallet setup.
verdict: Trust collapses when wallet setup and KYC requirements appear before users see the core value proposition (spending crypto like regular money). Crypto-native users abandon when security/privacy concerns exceed demonstrated value.

beliefBreak.irreversibleAction: User must make a commitment at step 1 of 8 (12% progress) without seeing value first.

callouts.text: Sensitive data requested at peak commitment
No established trust before financial disclosure

beliefBreak.psychology: Users arrive expecting to explore options, but immediately encounter a request for personal information. The mismatch between initial expectations and actual requirements triggers immediate abandonment.

userBelieves: This is a quick exploration tool
They can browse options without commitment
The platform will show value before asking for data
productAsks: Make a commitment without seeing value
whyItFails: Value not demonstrated before data request

oneBet.headline: Show personalized recommendations BEFORE requesting financial disclosure.
oneBet.support: If users see tailored results based solely on preferences, establishing value before trust demands, completion rates should increase.

howWrong.name: Value-First Sequencing Test
howWrong.hypothesis: Users abandon due to premature data request, not data request itself
howWrong.measure: Completion rate when financial questions move to post-recommendation vs current placement
howWrong.falsifier: If post-recommendation placement shows equal abandonment, timing isn't the blocker.

howWrong.name: Progressive Disclosure Test
howWrong.hypothesis: Users need gradual trust building through value demonstration
howWrong.measure: Engagement with initial recommendations (no financial data) vs refined recommendations (with data)
howWrong.falsifier: If users don't engage with initial recommendations, they don't value the output.

howWrong.name: Framing Transparency Test
howWrong.hypothesis: Bait-and-switch perception drives exit more than data request
howWrong.measure: Completion rate when step 1 explicitly mentions 'financial info needed' vs silent
howWrong.falsifier: If transparency reduces starts, users actively avoid financial disclosure regardless of timing.

assumptions: Users discovered Pluto PE - Crypto Spend & Manage Platform through organic search or ads promising 'instant recommendations'
Competing platforms offer immediate results without financial disclosure
Users have not yet established relationship with the brand
constraints: Accurate matching requires some financial data
Lending partners require minimum qualification criteria
rationale: Privacy reassurance appears only AFTER request — too late for trust building
Landing page shows value proposition (9.99% p.a., up to ₹1 Crore) but doesn't show personalized eligibility
Users see generic benefits but must start process to learn if they qualify
Competing platforms show initial matches without credit score disclosure

marginNotes.page2: Note: 12% progress indicator creates expectation of completion, not new high-friction requirement.
marginNotes.page4: High confidence: Pattern observed across fintech onboarding where value-before-trust sequencing improves conversion.
marginNotes.page5: Alternative hypothesis: Users lack credit score knowledge, not willingness to share. Test 'Don't know my score' option.
marginNotes.page3: Landing page promises exploration, but immediately requires personal information — expectation mismatch from the start.

earlyAdopters.primaryConcern: Wallet proliferation fatigue - already have MetaMask/Rainbow
earlyAdopters.insight: Need to clearly differentiate from existing wallet solutions. Emphasize 'spend like regular money' not just 'another wallet'.
earlyAdopters.plutoPEFit: High - Crypto debit cards and DeFi services are unique value props they don't have in MetaMask
earlyAdopters.motivation: Want to spend crypto easily, not just hold it. Pluto PE's Visa debit card addresses this gap.
earlyAdopters.keyMessage: This isn't just another wallet - it's your crypto spending solution with Visa debit card and 3.5% cashback
earlyAdopters.onboardingPreference: Quick import existing wallet option, skip full setup if they already have MetaMask/Rainbow

privacyMaximalists.primaryConcern: KYC/Privacy Policy seen as centralization red flag
privacyMaximalists.insight: Terms of Service step is killing privacy-focused users. Consider progressive disclosure or optional KYC paths.
privacyMaximalists.plutoPEFit: Medium-High - Non-custodial nature aligns with privacy values, but KYC for debit card creates tension
privacyMaximalists.motivation: Value decentralization and privacy. Pluto PE's non-custodial wallet is perfect, but KYC requirement for debit card is a blocker.
privacyMaximalists.keyMessage: Your keys, your crypto. Non-custodial wallet with optional debit card (KYC only if you want the card)
privacyMaximalists.onboardingPreference: Wallet setup without KYC first, add debit card later if needed

securityAnxious.primaryConcern: Seed phrase backup anxiety - fear of losing funds
securityAnxious.insight: Secret phrase step needs better guidance and reassurance. Consider social recovery or multi-sig options.
securityAnxious.plutoPEFit: High - BitGo encryption and security features address their concerns, but onboarding needs to build trust
securityAnxious.motivation: Have lost funds before or know someone who has. Need maximum security with clear guidance.
securityAnxious.keyMessage: Enterprise-grade security (BitGo encryption) with step-by-step guidance. Your funds are secure.
securityAnxious.onboardingPreference: Guided tutorial mode with clear explanations, optional social recovery setup

merchants.primaryConcern: Fiat settlement clarity missing - how do I get paid in INR?
merchants.insight: Merchants need to see fiat settlement path earlier. 'Spend Anywhere' doesn't address their core need.
merchants.plutoPEFit: Very High - Crypto payment acceptance with fiat settlement is core value prop, but not communicated early enough
merchants.motivation: Want to accept crypto payments from customers but need INR settlement for business operations.
merchants.keyMessage: Accept crypto payments, get settled in INR automatically. Lower fees than traditional payment processors.
merchants.onboardingPreference: Merchant-specific flow showing payment acceptance → INR settlement → tax docs early in the process

freelancers.primaryConcern: Crypto-to-fiat conversion clarity and tax compliance
freelancers.insight: Similar to merchants but different pain point. Need to show simple conversion to INR with tax docs.
freelancers.plutoPEFit: Very High - Lower international transaction fees (3x savings) is huge value for freelancers getting paid globally
freelancers.motivation: Get paid in crypto by international clients, convert to INR easily, need tax documentation for compliance.
freelancers.keyMessage: Get paid in crypto globally, convert to INR with 3x lower fees. Automatic tax documentation included.
freelancers.onboardingPreference: Freelancer flow highlighting: receive crypto → convert to INR → tax docs → lower fees vs traditional

cryptoNewbies.primaryConcern: Complexity overload - too many security steps without education
cryptoNewbies.insight: 8-step flow is too long for newcomers. Consider guided tutorial mode or progressive wallet setup.
cryptoNewbies.plutoPEFit: High - 'Zero prior crypto knowledge required' is key differentiator, but onboarding doesn't reflect this
cryptoNewbies.motivation: Want to get into crypto but intimidated by complexity. Need simple, educational onboarding.
cryptoNewbies.keyMessage: No crypto knowledge needed. We guide you step-by-step. Start spending crypto like regular money.
cryptoNewbies.onboardingPreference: Guided tutorial mode with educational tooltips, simplified security setup, demo mode first

keyInsights: 6-step delay to value (Wallet Balance) is killing conversion. Crypto users expect faster utility.
Wallet Setup step immediately triggers 'why do I need another wallet?' comparison to existing solutions.
Legal/Terms step is a privacy red flag for crypto-native users who value decentralization.
Secret Phrase Backup creates anxiety - users who've lost funds before are especially vulnerable here.
Merchants and freelancers drop later (steps 5-6) but need fiat settlement clarity earlier in the flow.
Value proposition (Spend Anywhere) appears at step 6, but should appear before wallet setup to anchor user intent.
recommendations: Show value proposition BEFORE wallet setup - lead with 'Spend crypto like regular money' demo/simulator
Make KYC optional or progressive - let users start without it, add later when needed for limits
Offer multiple wallet options - import existing wallet, or quick demo mode without full setup
Add fiat settlement preview for merchants/freelancers earlier - 'Accept crypto, get paid in INR' messaging
Reduce steps from 8 to 5-6 by combining legal/passcode or making some steps optional
Add 'Import MetaMask' shortcut for early adopters who already have wallets
Create guided mode for newbies vs. express mode for crypto-native users
Show seed phrase backup importance through micro-education, not just instructions

competitorComparison.metaMask: Users compare to MetaMask - need clear differentiation in value prop
competitorComparison.rainbow: Better UX in existing wallets - need to match or exceed their onboarding speed
competitorComparison.coinbase: Centralized exchange onboarding is faster - but you're competing on decentralization
competitorComparison.paypalCrypto: Users expect PayPal-like simplicity - can you match that UX for crypto?

productSpecificRecommendations.recommendation: Lead with crypto debit card value prop before wallet setup
productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: Your unique differentiator (Visa debit card with 3.5% cashback) should anchor user intent before asking them to set up wallet
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Show 'Spend crypto anywhere Visa is accepted' demo/simulator on landing page, then offer wallet setup as means to enable this

productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: Merchants/freelancers need different info (fiat settlement) than individual users (spending crypto)
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Ask 'What do you want to do?' first: (1) Spend crypto, (2) Accept crypto payments, (3) Manage crypto portfolio - then customize flow

productSpecificRecommendations.recommendation: Make debit card KYC optional initially
productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: Privacy-maximalists will abandon at KYC step. Let them use wallet first, add debit card later when they see value
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Wallet setup without KYC → show wallet balance → offer debit card as upgrade with clear benefits

productSpecificRecommendations.recommendation: Highlight 3x lower fees for international transactions early
productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: This is huge value for freelancers/merchants but appears too late in current flow
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Add 'Save 3x on international payments' messaging in steps 1-2, especially for merchant/freelancer personas

productSpecificRecommendations.recommendation: Add 'Import MetaMask' shortcut for crypto-native users
productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: Early adopters already have wallets. Don't make them create new one - let them import and go straight to spending
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Step 1: 'Create new wallet' OR 'Import existing wallet (MetaMask/Rainbow)' - import path skips to step 6

productSpecificRecommendations.rationale: Security-anxious users need reassurance before seed phrase step, not after
productSpecificRecommendations.implementation: Add 'Secured by BitGo' badge and explanation in wallet setup step, before asking for seed phrase
